docs.abstract: United States is struggling to re-envision its diplomatic ties with Europe after Britain, its key ally and facilitator in region, votes to leave bloc; American officials are downcast about lack of comparable partner on Continent to help manage already fragile international system.

headline.main: With ‘Brexit,’ Washington’s Direct Line to the Continent Suddenly Frays
